title: 'Hi, kids. I'm sorry that I have some bad news': Daughter sends a cat meme in the family group chat, finds out that her parents are divorcing, and awkwardly, the hilarious cat remains the last thing sent in the group
description: You know, as cat people, we use cat memes to express all kinds of emotions in all kinds of situations. In any appropriate (and sometimes inappropriate) situation, we send funny cat memes to our friends. The best reaction meme is a cat meme, we think that just about every cat person would agree with us on that. What we cannot say is that we have used a cat meme to break bad news. Somehow, it feels particularly inappropriate to use a cat meme in a sad situation. Cat memes should remain the happy and pawsitive thing that they are. Or so we thought. We thought that cat memes in sad situations would feel inappropriate and disrespectful and wrong, but alas, we were mistaken. It seems that cat memes make sad situations funny. Still sad, but also funny. At least that is the feeling that we (and a lot of other people on the internet) got from this ridiculous viral thread on twitter. Are we biased when it comes to cat memes? Maybe. What do you think?
author: Mariel Ruvinsky

text: You know, we have always suspected that this cat had some kind of superpowers that we have simply yet to understand, and we think that this… this is the first glimpse that we are getting into them. We were all safe from this feline before it was famous, but now… now, we can all be affected by her.  We are sorry to hear that this happened to you. It's sad. But at the very least, the last thing in that group chat is a positive thing. If you can call this specific picture of this specific cat positive. But we choose to. This picture has brought us much joy, and we pray to Ceiling Cat that it will continue to do so.

You know, we have always suspected that this cat had some kind of superpowers that we have simply yet to understand, and we think that this… this is the first glimpse that we are getting into them. We were all safe from this feline before it was famous, but now… now, we can all be affected by her. 

We are sorry to hear that this happened to you. It's sad. But at the very least, the last thing in that group chat is a positive thing. If you can call this specific picture of this specific cat positive. But we choose to. This picture has brought us much joy, and we pray to Ceiling Cat that it will continue to do so.
